techmeme.title: Netflix struggles to reduce its productions' carbon footprint, with more emissions in 2022 vs. 2019, partly because it doesn't own any equipment or studio space (Michelle Ma/Bloomberg)
X debuts a beta TV app "on several app stores", like for Amazon Fire TV and Google TV, to court advertisers, creators, and partners to a "video-first platform" (TechCrunch)
Elon Musk's attacks on Kamala Harris, including AI-generated images that lack scrutiny from Community Notes, show how he has turned X into a pro-Trump machine (Donie O'Sullivan/CNN)
Elon Musk, in an eventually deleted X post, promoted a Tucker Carlson interview with a Hitler apologist who downplayed the Holocaust and said Nazis were humane (Rhian Lubin/The Independent)
Anthropic launches Claude Enterprise, offering a context window of 500,000 tokens, higher rate limits, and GitHub integration, but refuses to disclose the price (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
